intro: Eliokarmos inclusus, commonly known as the narrowleaf elokarmos, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
